intro: Psychotria uberta, commonly known as the "Amazonian psychotria," is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the undergrowth of rainforests. Psychotria uberta is also known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal.
